parametrized_description: A water salesman transports water using small and large kegs. Each small keg has a capacity of SmallKegCapacity liters, while each large keg has a capacity of LargeKegCapacity liters. The salesman can use at most MaxSmallKegsAvailable small kegs and MaxLargeKegsAvailable large kegs. The number of small kegs used must be at least SmallKegMultiplier times the number of large kegs used. The total number of kegs transported cannot exceed MaxTotalKegs, and at least MinLargeKegs large kegs must be used. Determine the number of small and large kegs to maximize the total amount of water transported.

SmallKegCapacity.description: Capacity of a small keg in liters

LargeKegCapacity.description: Capacity of a large keg in liters

MaxSmallKegsAvailable.description: Maximum number of small kegs available

MaxLargeKegsAvailable.description: Maximum number of large kegs available

SmallKegMultiplier.description: The multiplier for the number of small kegs to be used compared to large kegs

MaxTotalKegs.description: Maximum total number of kegs that can be transported

MinLargeKegs.description: Minimum number of large kegs that must be used

NumSmallKegsUsed.description: The number of small kegs used

NumLargeKegsUsed.description: The number of large kegs used

constraints.description: The number of small kegs used must not exceed MaxSmallKegsAvailable.
The number of large kegs used must not exceed MaxLargeKegsAvailable.
The number of small kegs used must be at least SmallKegMultiplier times the number of large kegs used.
The total number of kegs transported cannot exceed MaxTotalKegs.
At least MinLargeKegs large kegs must be used.

objective.description: Maximize the total amount of water transported, which is the sum of the capacities of the small and large kegs used.
